work.name: Koops Automation Systems - Holland, MI
work.summary: The work done at Koops Automation Systems happened in two 15 week intervals. The first 15 week interval consisted of controlls programming, while the second 15 week interval consisted of project engineering
highlights: Prototyped an automated bagging solution for car seats, involving iterative testing and refinement to optimize the packaging process
Implemented data tracking functionalities within the PLC and HMI systems, enabling real-time monitoring and analysis of the manufacturing process.
Participated in the on-site integration of a tractor seat manufacturing machine, gaining hands-on experience in the deployment and startup of industrial automation equipment.
Developed comprehensive user documentation for a Human-Machine Interface (HMI), providing clear and concise instructions for operation and monitoring of automated systems.

Anticipated the needs of guests and ensured that guests felt welcome
Ensured the building was up to standard with city fire code to prevent unnecessary disasters

Negotiated contracts with carriers in a manner that optimized profits

Maintained up-to-date knowledge of market trends in the transportation marketplace

Communicated urgent orders and directions effectively to a team of 500 personnel resulting in one of the larges railhead operations in recent Camp Lejeune history
Assisted with the preparation, planning, and execution of strategic mobility plans used to deploy and sustain forward deployed forces
